title: If You See This Stone, Don’t You Dare Touch It
description:
They might look harmless — even beautiful — but some stones can be deadly. Around the world, the Earth hides minerals so toxic they’ve taken lives and caused serious illnesses. Take crocidolite, or blue asbestos, for example. Found in Western Australia, Bolivia, and South Africa, it’s one of the most dangerous minerals ever discovered, linked to thousands of deaths. Then there’s erionite, found in Turkey and at least 12 U.S. states — its tiny fibers can cause deadly lung cancer. So, if you ever come across a mysterious glittering stone while hiking or exploring, think twice before you pick it up. Some of Earth’s prettiest treasures are better left untouched.

title: Your Classroom Map Was Lying to You
description:
Your classroom map has been lying to you — and it’s not just a small mistake. For over 500 years, the world has been looking at a distorted version of itself. The Mercator projection — originally designed to help sailors navigate — accidentally shrank entire continents, especially Africa. On the map you grew up with, Africa looks modest. In reality, it’s massive — it could fit the U.S., China, India, and much more inside it! This isn’t just a cartography error; researchers call it a “geographical deception” that shaped how generations have seen global power, size, and importance. So, the next time you look at a world map… remember, the truth is way bigger than it seems.
